trans-unit.source: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network client provides a tracing facility to collect JDBC trace information and view protocol flows.

seg-source.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network client provides a tracing facility to collect JDBC trace information and view protocol flows.

target.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network client provides a tracing facility to collect JDBC trace information and view protocol flows.

trans-unit.source: There are various ways to obtain trace output. However, the easiest way to obtain trace output is to use the traceFile=path attribute on the URL in ij. The following example shows all tracing going to the file trace.out from an ij session.

seg-source.mrk: There are various ways to obtain trace output.
However, the easiest way to obtain trace output is to use the traceFile=path attribute on the URL in ij.
The following example shows all tracing going to the file <codeph>trace.out</codeph> from an <codeph>ij</codeph> session.

target.mrk: There are various ways to obtain trace output.
However, the easiest way to obtain trace output is to use the traceFile=path attribute on the URL in ij.
The following example shows all tracing going to the file <codeph>trace.out</codeph> from an <codeph>ij</codeph> session.

trans-unit.source: To append trace information to the specified file, use the traceFileAppend=true URL attribute in addition to traceFile=path.

seg-source.mrk: To append trace information to the specified file, use the traceFileAppend=true URL attribute in addition to traceFile=path.

target.mrk: To append trace information to the specified file, use the traceFileAppend=true URL attribute in addition to traceFile=path.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see "traceFile=path attribute" and "traceFileAppend=true attribute" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: For more information, see "traceFile=path attribute" and "traceFileAppend=true attribute" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.

target.mrk: For more information, see "traceFile=path attribute" and "traceFileAppend=true attribute" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: You can use one of three methods to collect tracing data while obtaining connections from the <codeph>ClientDataSource</codeph>:

seg-source.mrk: You can use one of three methods to collect tracing data while obtaining connections from the <codeph>ClientDataSource</codeph>:

target.mrk: You can use one of three methods to collect tracing data while obtaining connections from the <codeph>ClientDataSource</codeph>:

trans-unit.source: Use the <codeph>setLogWriter(java.io.PrintWriter)</codeph> method of <codeph>ClientDataSource</codeph> and set the <codeph>PrintWriter</codeph> to a non-null value.

seg-source.mrk: Use the <codeph>setLogWriter(java.io.PrintWriter)</codeph> method of <codeph>ClientDataSource</codeph> and set the <codeph>PrintWriter</codeph> to a non-null value.

target.mrk: Use the <codeph>setLogWriter(java.io.PrintWriter)</codeph> method of <codeph>ClientDataSource</codeph> and set the <codeph>PrintWriter</codeph> to a non-null value.

trans-unit.source: Use the <codeph>setTraceDirectory(String dirname)</codeph> method of <codeph>ClientDataSource</codeph> to trace each connection flow in its own file for programs that have multiple connections.

seg-source.mrk: Use the <codeph>setTraceDirectory(String dirname)</codeph> method of <codeph>ClientDataSource</codeph> to trace each connection flow in its own file for programs that have multiple connections.

target.mrk: Use the <codeph>setTraceDirectory(String dirname)</codeph> method of <codeph>ClientDataSource</codeph> to trace each connection flow in its own file for programs that have multiple connections.

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> provides three <codeph>ClientDataSource</codeph> implementations. You can use the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.ClientDataSource</codeph> class on Java SE 5 and above (except Java SE 8 Compact Profiles), in applications that call JDBC 3 or JDBC 4.0 methods. You can use the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.ClientDataSource40</codeph> class on Java SE 6 and above (except Java SE 8 Compact Profiles), in applications that call JDBC 4.1 or JDBC 4.2 methods. You must use the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.BasicClientDataSource40</codeph>class on Java SE 8 Compact Profile 2 or 3.

seg-source.mrk: You can use the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.ClientDataSource</codeph> class on Java SE 5 and above (except Java SE 8 Compact Profiles), in applications that call JDBC 3 or JDBC 4.0 methods.
You can use the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.ClientDataSource40</codeph> class on Java SE 6 and above (except Java SE 8 Compact Profiles), in applications that call JDBC 4.1 or JDBC 4.2 methods.
You must use the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.BasicClientDataSource40</codeph>class on Java SE 8 Compact Profile 2 or 3.

target.mrk: You can use the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.ClientDataSource</codeph> class on Java SE 5 and above (except Java SE 8 Compact Profiles), in applications that call JDBC 3 or JDBC 4.0 methods.
You can use the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.ClientDataSource40</codeph> class on Java SE 6 and above (except Java SE 8 Compact Profiles), in applications that call JDBC 4.1 or JDBC 4.2 methods.
You must use the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.BasicClientDataSource40</codeph>class on Java SE 8 Compact Profile 2 or 3.

trans-unit.source: Use one of the following two options to enable and collect tracing information while obtaining connections using the <codeph>DriverManager</codeph>:

seg-source.mrk: Use one of the following two options to enable and collect tracing information while obtaining connections using the <codeph>DriverManager</codeph>:

target.mrk: Use one of the following two options to enable and collect tracing information while obtaining connections using the <codeph>DriverManager</codeph>:

trans-unit.source: Use the <codeph>setLogWriter(java.io.PrintWriter)</codeph> method of <codeph>DriverManager</codeph> and set the <codeph>PrintWriter</codeph> to a non null-value.

seg-source.mrk: Use the <codeph>setLogWriter(java.io.PrintWriter)</codeph> method of <codeph>DriverManager</codeph> and set the <codeph>PrintWriter</codeph> to a non null-value.

target.mrk: Use the <codeph>setLogWriter(java.io.PrintWriter)</codeph> method of <codeph>DriverManager</codeph> and set the <codeph>PrintWriter</codeph> to a non null-value.

trans-unit.source: Use the traceFile=path or traceDirectory=path URL attributes to set these properties prior to creating the connection with the DriverManager.getConnection() method. For more information, see "traceFile=path attribute" and "traceDirectory=path attribute" in the .

seg-source.mrk: Use the traceFile=path or traceDirectory=path URL attributes to set these properties prior to creating the connection with the DriverManager.getConnection() method.
For more information, see "traceFile=path attribute" and "traceDirectory=path attribute" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.

target.mrk: Use the traceFile=path or traceDirectory=path URL attributes to set these properties prior to creating the connection with the DriverManager.getConnection() method.
For more information, see "traceFile=path attribute" and "traceDirectory=path attribute" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: The default trace level is ClientDataSource.TRACE_ALL. You can choose the tracing level by calling the setTraceLevel(int level) method or by setting the traceLevel=value URL attribute:

seg-source.mrk: You can choose the tracing level by calling the setTraceLevel(int level) method or by setting the traceLevel=value URL attribute:

target.mrk: You can choose the tracing level by calling the setTraceLevel(int level) method or by setting the traceLevel=value URL attribute:

trans-unit.source: The following table shows the tracing levels you can set.

seg-source.mrk: The following table shows the tracing levels you can set.

target.mrk: The following table shows the tracing levels you can set.

trans-unit.source: This table lists the network client tracing levels and their values.

seg-source.mrk: This table lists the network client tracing levels and their values.

target.mrk: This table lists the network client tracing levels and their values.

trans-unit.source: To specify more than one trace level, use one of the following techniques:

seg-source.mrk: To specify more than one trace level, use one of the following techniques:

target.mrk: To specify more than one trace level, use one of the following techniques:

trans-unit.source: Use bitwise OR operators ( | ) with two or more trace values. For example, to trace PROTOCOL flows and connection calls, specify this value for <codeph>traceLevel</codeph>:

seg-source.mrk: Use bitwise OR operators ( | ) with two or more trace values.
For example, to trace PROTOCOL flows and connection calls, specify this value for <codeph>traceLevel</codeph>:

target.mrk: Use bitwise OR operators ( | ) with two or more trace values.
For example, to trace PROTOCOL flows and connection calls, specify this value for <codeph>traceLevel</codeph>:

trans-unit.source: Use a bitwise complement operator ( ~ ) with a trace value to specify all except a certain trace. For example, to trace everything except PROTOCOL flows, specify this value for <codeph>traceLevel</codeph>:

seg-source.mrk: Use a bitwise complement operator ( ~ ) with a trace value to specify all except a certain trace.
For example, to trace everything except PROTOCOL flows, specify this value for <codeph>traceLevel</codeph>:

target.mrk: Use a bitwise complement operator ( ~ ) with a trace value to specify all except a certain trace.
For example, to trace everything except PROTOCOL flows, specify this value for <codeph>traceLevel</codeph>:

trans-unit.source: For more information, see "traceLevel=value attribute" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.
